protocol.text: Thirty-day-old plants were then subjected to high osmotic stress by adding 0.3M mannitol to the basal MGRL medium for 3 hr in the light. Recovery plants were transfer back to the MGRL medium for 1 day after stress treatment and sampled.

Arabidopsis thaliana ecotype Columbia-0 was used as Wild-type.For hydroponic culture, WT seeds after a 3-day cold treatment at 4degreeC were sowed on rock wool (Grodan Inc.) pre-soaked in MGRL media. In short, plants were grown at 22degreeC with a 150 μmol m-2 S-1 fluorescence rate and under 12 hour / 12 hour light dark cycle in MGRL hydroponic medium.

Each array probe for Arabidopsis Genechip ATH1 was synthesized from 1 μg total RNA extracted by RNA easy extraction kit (Qiagen). Eighteen individual Genechip probes with three biological replicates for CL (Col Leaf), CR (Col Root), OL (Osmotic stressed Leaf), OR (Osmotic stressed Root), RL (Recovery Leaf), and RR (Recovery Root).
Probe synthesis, hybridization and scanning of all arrays were carried out at the Genomics Resource Center in the Rockefeller University following the manufacturer’s manual (Affymetrix).
Probe synthesis, hybridization and scanning of all arrays were carried out at the Genomics Resource Center in the Rockefeller University following the manufacturer’s manual (Affymetrix).
Probe synthesis, hybridization and scanning of all arrays were carried out at the Genomics Resource Center in the Rockefeller University following the manufacturer’s manual (Affymetrix).

Background correction was performed as described by Irizarry et al. (2003). Quantile normalization was performed as described by Bolstad et al (2003). Finally, probes were summarized into single gene expression (probe-set) values on a per chip basis using the medianpolish algorithm (Tukey, 1977).
